go_data.justification: betaPS is found at an integrin-rich cell junction, analogous to an intercalated disc.
betaPS, as an integrin, is likely involved in integrin-mediated signaling pathways.
A novel alpha integrin subunit associates with betaPS and functions in tissue morphogenesis and movement during Drosophila development.
As an integrin, betaPS is involved in cell adhesion.
betaPS is expressed in cardiomyocytes and is necessary for maintaining myofibril structure.
